modName: SPECTRUM v4 - ENB preset - enhanced optics with LSD
summary: BASED ON ENB BINARIES 0.292 (will work with newer) - LIGHTWEIGHT, FAST AND STABLE - EnBoost and Memory Fix added
descriptionHtml:
[center]
[font=Tahoma][url=http://www.directupload.net][img]http://s7.directupload.net/images/130824/az5wdmtn.jpg[/img][/url]
[u][url=https://www.dropbox.com/sh/l42t7gv4u2s4viq/AAA_MExBNZ92otGki5w1T1OJa?dl=0][size=6]WANNA SEE MORE?? VIEW MY DROPBOX GALLERY!![/size][/url][/u]
[color=#6d9eeb][size=4][b]Feel free to upload some of your screenshots on Nexus... it would be damn appreciated![/b][/size][/color]
[url=http://www.directupload.net][img]http://s7.directupload.net/images/130912/shiavzp5.jpg[/img][/url]
[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size]

[size=3][size=6][b][color=#ff0000]S [/color][color=#008000][color=#00ff00]P[/color] [/color][color=#ffff00]E [/color][color=#00ffff]C [/color][color=#ff0000]T [/color][color=#008000][color=#00ff00]R[/color] [/color][color=#ffff00]U [/color][color=#00ffff]M[/color]    v.4[/b][/size]
[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size]
BASED ON 0.292 ENB BINARIES (works also with newer, last tested with 0.308)
[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size]
LIGHTWEIGHT, FAST AND STABLE
[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size]

[size=2]Hello everybody!! At first, I know my English sucks but my German is better :-P
I've spend maaaaaaaaaany time on tweaking ENB for GTA4 & Skyrim so I thought it would be nice to share my preset! If you don't like cinematic effects and want powerful colors paired with deep contrast... This ENB should be the right one for you!
[color=#ffff00][b]
My main goal was/is to create an ENB preset which is full playable at every ingame time. Many ENB presets seems to be tweaked only for screenshots and/or not for every weather type. The most common result is you can't see anything at night or you get whelmed by Lens Flare and other additional FX at daytime. With this preset I've tried to avoid that!
(Ok, at cloudy or rainy nights its still dark as hell and you even got Lens Flare but not in a obtrusive way)
I'm "only" using 2x Geforce GTX 660ti OC (SLI) witch 2GB VRAM but my Skyrim still runs with tons of HD
Textures (40+GB Skyrim Folder) and with the max amount of .esp... thats why
I also tried to keep the performance hit as low as possible! [/b][/color]

[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/size]
[font=Tahoma][size=2][i][b][size=6][color=#ff0000][/color][/size][font=Tahoma][size=2][i][b][size=6][color=#ff0000]F[/color][color=#00ff00] . [/color][color=#ffff00]A [/color][color=#00ffff]. [/color][color=#ff0000]Q [/color][color=#00ff00]. [/color][/size][/b][/i][/size][/font]
[/b][/i][size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][i][b]
[/b][/i][i][color=#b6b6b6][/color][/i][/size][/font]
[color=#ff0000]Q: I use [font=Tahoma][size=3][size=2] [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel[/url] or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52423/?]Pure Weather[/url], and/or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30450/?]Realistic Lighting Overhaul[/url] or [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url][/size][/size][/font]! Is this a problem?[/color]
[color=#00ff00]A: No, its PERFECT cause I tweaked the whole lighting for these mods! [/color]

[color=#ff0000]Q: I'm not using any lightning/weather mod! Is this a problem?[/color]
[color=#00ff00]Just give it a try, it should still looks awesome but i can't guarantee for correct interior and dungeon lightning.
[/color]
[color=#ff0000]Q: I use tons of texture replacers, are there any problems?[/color]
[color=#00ff00]A: Nope, but some textures looks a bit cartoony. I prefer [/color][color=#00ff00][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61995/?]TAMRIEL RELOADED HD
[/url](Very sick textures!!! You should give it a try... unless your GPU sucks)[/color][color=#00ff00] [/color]

[color=#ff0000]Q: I'm new to ENB...heeeeeelp?![/color]
[color=#00ff00]A: Go to [url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.htmhttp://]THIS [/url]page and download the latest binarys, then follow instructions below![/color]

[color=#ff0000]Q: I've got a Titanium GTX GTR Trololol Turbo...can my rig handle it?[/color]
[color=#00ff00]A: Can you handle it?! ... Seriously you will need a good GPU with at least 2GB VRAM[/color]

[color=#ff0000]Q: Will this be lorefriendly???[/color]
[color=#00ff00]A: Go home, ask your mama![/color]
[/size][/size][/font]
[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/size][/center][center][font=Tahoma][size=2][i][b][size=6][color=#ff0000]F[/color][color=#00ff00] E [/color][color=#ffff00]A [/color][color=#00ffff]T [/color][color=#ff0000]U [/color][color=#00ff00]R [/color][color=#ffff00]E [/color][color=#00ffff]S[/color][/size]
[/b][/i][size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][i][b]
[/b][/i][i][color=#b6b6b6]
[i][i][i]Working on next update:[/i][/i][/i]
[i][i]Better anti aliasing
Some small light and color changes
Additional FX
Alternative (sepia style) preset
full 0.308 support

...but I will be honest...spending so much time in SkyrimSE now...don't know when I find time for updating this preset =(
[/i][/i][/color][/i][size=4][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][color=#ffffff]
[/color][/color][/b][/b][/b][/size][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][size=4]NEW in v4[/size]
[color=#ffffff]More intense sun:
- Increased power
- Removed Corona
- Added Lens Texture (THX [b]amoebae[/b])
- Added DCS to sun lightning
New DOF effect (THX kingeric1992)
 Tweaked ambient-, direct- and pointlightning[/color][/b][/color][/b][/b][/b][/color][/b][/b][/b][/color][/b][/b][i][b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b][i][b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b][i][b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b]
[/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][/b][/i][/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][/b][/i][/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][/b][/i][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][font=Tahoma][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][color=#ffffff][font=Tahoma][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][color=#ffffff][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][b][b][color=#00ff00][b][color=#ffffff]Clear, blue water (since v4.3)[/color] [/b][/color][/b][/b][/b][/color][/b][/b][/b][/color][/b][/b][/color][/color][/b][/b][/b][/font][/color][/color][/b][/b][/b][/font][/b][/color][/b][/b][/b][/color][/b][/b][/b][/color][/b][/b][i][b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b][i][b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b][i][b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b]
[/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][/b][/i][/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][/b][/i][/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][/b][/i][b]
[color=#00ff00][size=4][b]Memory Fixes & Particle Patch inside[/b][/size][/color][/b][i][b][color=#00ff00][i][b]
[/b][/i][/color][/b][/i][color=#00ff00][color=#ffffff]Added strings from EnBoost to my enblocal.ini for a reduced System RAM usage
Added SKSE Memory Fix that expand Memory Block size (from 256 to 512 MB)[/color][/color][i][b]
[/b][/i]Added mindflux's particle patch into preset

[size=4][b][color=#00ff00]DCS[/color][/b][/size]
Dynamic Color Spectrum - Added color tint at Day, Night, Sunrise and Sunset for a more atmospheric lighting
(Sunrise = yellow, sunset = red, night = blue)
[/size][/font][font=Tahoma][size=2][i][b]
[/b][/i][size=4][b][color=#00ff00]DSR[/color][/b][/size][/size][/font][font=Tahoma][size=2]
Dynamic Sun Rays - The sun ray intensity and color changes with the time of Day[/size][/font][size=2]
[/size][font=Tahoma][size=2]
[color=#00ff00][size=4][b]SDV[/b][/size][/color]
Short Distance (night)View - most ENBs are imo much too dark at night. Skyrim's moon is huuuuge, no moonlight at all?! So I've tried to create a adequate view at night, for not running into trees all the time (Inside deep woods/dungeons/interiors without windows its still DARK!!!)[/size][/font][size=2]
[/size][font=Tahoma][size=4][color=#00ff00]
[b]BGS[/b][/color][/size][/font][font=Tahoma][size=2]
Better got Sunglasses - if you use fire spells or look directly into fire or the sun, you will be slightly dazzled by the light
[color=#00ff00]
[size=4][b]LSD[/b][/size][/color]
Licht & Shader Datei - added TechniColor, Tonemap and Bloom for even [b][color=#ff0000]M[/color][color=#008000]O[/color][color=#ffff00]R[/color][color=#00ffff]E[/color][/b] powerful colors!!!

[color=#00ff00][size=4][b]3 Optional Palette Textures[/b][/size][/color]
Original, Dust, Warm and Cold...click ---> [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/8dh4o6w9a7a28l6/2015-06-20_00017.jpg?dl=0]HERE[/url] <--- for preview
[color=#ffffff][/color]
[size=2][url=http://www.directupload.net][img]http://fs1.directupload.net/images/150520/sgyvxb4m.jpg[/img][/url][/size]
[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/size]
[font=Tahoma][size=2][i][b][size=6][color=#ff0000]I[/color][color=#00ff00] N [/color][color=#ffff00]S [/color][color=#00ffff]T [/color][color=#ff0000]A [/color][color=#ffff00]L [/color][color=#00ffff]L [color=#ff0000]A [/color][color=#00ff00]T [/color][color=#ffff00]I [/color]O [color=#ff0000]N[/color][/color][/size]
[/b][/i][size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][i][b]
[/b][/i][/size][/font][color=#ffff00]
This is just a preset...so you need to download the d3d9.dll separately!
Then drop everything (the d3d9.dll and my preset) directly into your
Skyrim main folder. Read the "IMPORTANT READ ME" and follow the
instructions.

This binaries supports 64bit memory reducing features so you also need a 64bit OS to use this, of course!
To get benefits from the Memory Fix, you will need the latest SKSE!

Deactivate Skyrim's Anisotropic Filter and Anti Aliasing!

Please add/edit following strings in your Skyrimprefs.ini:

bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawLandShadows=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1

To disable the DOF effect, just rename or delete the file "enbeffectprepass.fx"[/color]
[color=#ffff00]
Adjust brightness with the in-game settings...Midpoint with trend to bright should be the best way, depending on your monitor settings![/color]

[color=#ffff00]W.A.T.E.R. users need "WaterPatch", found in the files section! [/color][/size]

[size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________
[/size]
[font=Tahoma][size=2][i][b][size=6][color=#ff0000]C[/color][color=#00ff00] O [/color][color=#ffff00]M [/color][color=#00ffff]M [/color][color=#ff0000]E [/color][color=#00ff00]N [/color][color=#ffff00]T [/color][color=#00ffff]S[/color][/size]
[/b][/i][size=2]___________________________________________________________________________________________________[/size][i][b]
[/b][/i][/size][/font][size=4]
I'm really glad about this comments because this are exactly the reasons for me to create & share this preset:[/size]
[/font][quote][font=Tahoma]I have tried nearly every one of the top ten, maybe even top twenty of the most popular ENB series presets and modifications and nearly all of them have been either too cinematic (i want to be immersed in the game not go to a movie), too dark, too bright, too oversaturated, undersaturated (im really picky).
This one fits just right, pretty much perfect for me, which is saying a lot.
Good work[/font][/quote][font=Tahoma]THX Hrolfjuid[/font][quote][font=Tahoma]I have tried a lots of ENB (about 20 atm in my ENB manager), and they all have points I like and some I dislike. Your ENB seems like a combination of all the things I like. Game runs smooth at 60fps and very stable.
Thanks a lot, I will stick with your ENB. Keep it up[/font][/quote][font=Tahoma]THX xxPEPE666xx[/font][quote][font=Tahoma]Extremely stable wIth the patch. Was getting CTD before the patch around every 15 minutes or so. Played 4 hours without a crash with patch. Also, thanks for sharing this ENB. I like it more than I do some of the more popular ones. It handles lighting tweaks that I make very well. With Spectrum, I can make a room (or nightfall) a little less dark without surreal specularity or making light sources too bright. Am running COT and RLO. Am also running project parallax Remastered. I enjoy the perception of depth that parallax gives to some textures, but don't enjoy the cartoony look that it gives other textures. I left parallexdebug disabled, as you have it by default, and there are no stability or stuttering issues. Thanks for including links to particle and water patches, as well.[/font][/quote][font=Tahoma]THX languageguy[/font][quote][font=Tahoma]As someone who has tried MANY ENB's and been disappointed in real gameplay with them looking great outside but not inside or vice versa, this looks great! looking forward to testing more. I have not been happy with an ENB for real gameplay since VandB which used 12.12.12! I may have at last found a replacement! And COT friendly (which I can't live without!
Kudos given for this great work! Thank you!![/font][/quote][font=Tahoma]THX aok
